wikipedia_page.main: Marion Keene (also known as Marion Davis, born Marion Davison, c. 1933) was a British big band singer in the early 1950s with British bands such as the Jack Parnell Orchestra and Oscar Rabin Band.

link_mentions.page: United Kingdom in the Eurovision Song Contest 1960
United Kingdom in the Eurovision Song Contest 1959
response: Twelve entries were shortlisted by the BBC for the contest. "I'll Be With You" was originally scheduled to be performed by Alma Cogan, but was replaced by Marion Keene.
| style="text-align:center;" | 6 || Marion Keene || "I'll Be With You"
*Marion Keene, known as Marion Davis, British big band singer
